channel.title: Testing GUIs :: K-State CIS 400 Textbook
channel.description: Testing a GUI-based application presents some serious challenges. A GUI has a strong dependence on the environment it is running in - the operating system is ultimately responsible for displaying the GUI components, and this is also influenced by the hardware it runs on. As we noted in our discussion of WPF, screen resolution can vary dramatically. So how our GUI appears on one machine may be completely acceptable, but unusable on another.
